title: Pre-Implementation: Create feature branch
description:
**Context**: Before starting the Karigor rebrand, we need a dedicated feature branch to isolate all changes from the main branch and enable proper code review.

**Objective**: Create a feature branch following semantic branch naming conventions for the rebrand work.

**Approach**:
1. Ensure you're on the main branch: git checkout main
2. Pull latest changes: git pull origin main
3. Create and switch to feature branch: git checkout -b feat/karigor-rebrand
4. Verify branch created: git branch --show-current

**Why This Approach**:
- Isolates rebrand work from production code
- Enables parallel development if needed
- Facilitates code review via PR
- Allows easy rollback if issues occur
- Follows semantic commit conventions (feat/ prefix)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
‚úì Branch named exactly 'feat/karigor-rebrand' exists
‚úì Currently on the new branch (git branch --show-current shows feat/karigor-rebrand)
‚úì Branch is based on latest main
‚úì No uncommitted changes present

**Validation**:
git branch --show-current | grep feat/karigor-rebrand
git status # Should show clean working tree

title: Pre-Implementation: Review planning documents
description:
**Context**: Understanding the full scope, requirements, and technical approach is critical before making any code changes. This prevents rework and ensures alignment with project goals.

**Objective**: Thoroughly review all planning documents to understand requirements, architecture decisions, and implementation strategy.

**Approach**:
1. Read PRD.md completely (30 min)
   - Focus on user stories and acceptance criteria
   - Note all 'Must Have' requirements
   - Understand the ZAI provider integration
2. Read IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md (45 min)
   - Study phase-by-phase breakdown
   - Note high-risk areas (provider changes, branding)
   - Review validation scripts
3. Read QUICKSTART.md (15 min)
   - Understand quick-start workflow
   - Note time estimates per phase
   - Review troubleshooting section
4. Read TASKS.md (10 min)
   - Cross-reference with Beads task list
   - Verify all tasks are captured

**Why This Approach**:
- Prevents scope creep and missed requirements
- Ensures understanding of 'why' behind each change
- Identifies dependencies and ordering constraints
- Reduces risk of breaking changes
- Aligns implementation with acceptance criteria

**Acceptance Criteria**:
‚úì Read all 4 planning documents completely
‚úì Understand the 6 phases and their dependencies
‚úì Clear on ZAI provider hardcoding approach
‚úì Familiar with ASCII-only requirement rationale
‚úì Know all 'Must Have' acceptance criteria from PRD
‚úì Understand config file migration (.crush ‚Üí .karigor)

**Validation**:
Can answer: Why single provider? Why ASCII only? What's the schema URL strategy? What are the 6 phases?

title: Pre-Implementation: Verify current state works
description:
**Context**: Establishing a known-good baseline is essential before starting modifications. This ensures any issues are caused by our changes, not pre-existing problems.

**Objective**: Verify the current Crush codebase builds and tests successfully, establishing a clean starting point.

**Approach**:
1. Clean any previous build artifacts: task clean (or go clean)
2. Run full build: task build
   - Verify no compilation errors
   - Confirm binary created: ./crush
3. Run complete test suite: task test
   - All tests must pass
   - Note any skipped tests
   - Check test coverage report
4. Optional: Run linter: task lint:fix
5. Document baseline state:
   - Git commit hash
   - Go version (go version)
   - Number of passing tests

**Why This Approach**:
- Establishes known-good baseline
- Identifies any pre-existing issues
- Validates development environment setup
- Provides rollback reference point
- Ensures dependencies are properly installed

**Acceptance Criteria**:
‚úì 'task build' completes with exit code 0
‚úì Binary ./crush is created and executable
‚úì './crush --version' shows version info
‚úì 'task test' passes 100% (0 failures)
‚úì No compilation errors or warnings
‚úì Go version is 1.25.5 or later
‚úì All dependencies downloaded (go.mod, go.sum intact)

**Validation**:
task build && task test && ./crush --version

**Expected Output**:
Build: success, binary created
Tests: all passing (example: ok  \tgithub.com/charmbracelet/crush/...)
Version: shows Crush version

**Troubleshooting**:
- If build fails: go mod tidy && go mod download
- If tests fail: check baseline commit is stable
- If version fails: verify PATH includes build output

title: 2.3: Remove provider selection UI
description:
**Context**: With only one hardcoded provider, the provider selection UI components are unnecessary and confusing. These should be removed or disabled to streamline the user experience.

**Objective**: Remove or disable all provider and model selection UI components in the TUI.

**Files**: 
- internal/tui/components/dialogs/models/ (model picker dialog)
- internal/tui/tui.go (dialog registration/routing)

**Two Strategies**:

Strategy 1: Remove Completely (Recommended)
- Delete model picker dialog component files
- Remove dialog registration from router
- Remove any key bindings that open model picker

Strategy 2: Make Read-Only Display
- Keep dialog components but disable interaction
- Show 'Current: Karigor Chintok' message
- Disable model switching functionality

**Implementation Steps**:
1. Search for model/provider selection components:
   grep -r 'model.*picker\|provider.*select' --include='*.go' internal/tui/
   grep -r 'switch.*model\|change.*provider' --include='*.go' internal/tui/

2. Find dialog registration in tui.go or router

3. Remove or disable the dialog component

**Why This Approach**:
- With only one provider, selection serves no purpose
- Simplifies TUI code and reduces complexity  
- Prevents user confusion when no other options exist
- Cleaner, more focused interface

**Acceptance Criteria**:
‚úì No provider selection UI available
‚úì No model switching UI available
‚úì Current model displays as 'Karigor Chintok'
‚úì No errors when attempting to access removed dialogs
‚úì TUI loads and runs normally

**Validation**:
go build .
./karigor
# Try to open model picker - should not exist or show read-only

title: Pre-Implementation: Backup current state
description:
**Context**: Creating a backup tag provides a safety net for quick rollback if critical issues are discovered during implementation.

**Objective**: Create an immutable Git tag marking the pre-rebrand state for emergency rollback capability.

**Approach**:
1. Ensure working tree is clean: git status
2. Verify on correct commit: git log -1 --oneline
3. Create annotated tag: git tag -a backup-pre-karigor -m 'Backup before Karigor rebrand - DO NOT DELETE'
4. Verify tag created: git tag -l backup-pre-karigor
5. Show tag details: git show backup-pre-karigor
6. Optional: Push tag to remote for team backup: git push origin backup-pre-karigor

**Why This Approach**:
- Provides instant rollback point (git reset --hard backup-pre-karigor)
- Creates immutable reference to working state
- Annotated tag includes metadata (author, date, message)
- Pushed tag serves as team safety net
- Prevents accidental loss if branch is corrupted

**Acceptance Criteria**:
‚úì Tag 'backup-pre-karigor' exists locally
‚úì Tag is annotated (not lightweight)
‚úì Tag message includes clear warning
‚úì Tag points to current HEAD commit
‚úì Working tree is clean (no uncommitted changes)
‚úì Optional: Tag pushed to origin for team access

**Validation**:
git tag -l | grep backup-pre-karigor
git show backup-pre-karigor | head -20

**Expected Output**:
tag backup-pre-karigor
Tagger: [your name] <[your email]>
Date: [current date]
Backup before Karigor rebrand - DO NOT DELETE

**Rollback Command** (if needed later):
git reset --hard backup-pre-karigor
